road_plan.to: Benjamin Franklin Statue at College Hall
road_plan.directions: Head east on Walnut St toward S 36th St, turn right onto S 36th St/36th St Walk, take the stairs and follow campus paths to College Hall. The Benjamin Franklin Statue is directly in front of College Hall.

road_plan.from: Benjamin Franklin Statue at College Hall
road_plan.directions: The statue is located directly in front of College Hall, so you can immediately explore this historic Victorian Gothic building, the oldest on campus.
Head east from College Hall, turn left toward S 34th St, take the stairs, then turn right onto S 34th St. The Fisher Fine Arts Library will be on your right.

road_plan.to: ENIAC Exhibits at School of Engineering
road_plan.directions: Head north on S 34th St toward Smith Walk, cross the road, then turn left onto Smith Walk. The School of Engineering building (220 S 33rd St) will be on your left, where ENIAC panels are displayed.

road_plan.from: ENIAC Exhibits at School of Engineering
road_plan.directions: Head southeast toward S 33rd St, turn right onto S 33rd St, then turn left onto South St. Turn right into the museum grounds, and the Penn Museum entrance will be on your left.
